Key Arguments: The proposed legislation could lead to censorship and suppression of free speech.
The definition of 'misinformation' or 'harmful' content is subjective and could be misused.
Existing legislation is sufficient to handle violent or illegal content.
The new powers could lead to industry self-censorship due to fear of penalties.
Notable Quotes: The expanded powers would have the potential to be used for censorship, quashing freedom of speech and limiting access to any content or opinion deemed to be not in the public interest, or 'harmful'.
The public has a right to decide for themselves what may or may not be 'misinformation', as they always have, based on their life experience and weighed by their common sense and their intelligence.
The proposed amendment is unnecessary and open to misuse. It facilitates censorship, suppression of free speech and control of access to information.
